chunks.text: First of all, we define a class in our java file
In our first lecture, we will hear many strange words
which we may not understand now
but as soon as we do 5-10 lectures
and finally read the concept of OOPS
OOPS means Object Oriented Programming Systems
This will look like a topic in your last chapters
When we will read this, we will understand the meaning of the words
So, in the first class, we will not focus on the meaning
We will focus on the working of the words
that we are able to execute a code
We will understand the meaning of the code with time
But the most important thing in coding is to keep your motivation
and the second most important thing is to keep fun
We do not want to kill off fun in the first class
So, we will have some complex words for now
We may not understand the meaning of the words
It may not be clear
So, it is okay
We just have to be patient
In the later classes, they have been discussed in great detail
So, first of all, we define a class to write all the code
Public, Class, Java, Basics
Now, what is a class?
We have heard about a classroom in colleges and schools
where all the students are sitting and all the work is done in the class
Similarly, in Java, there is a class
in which we write all the code
and all the code work is done in the class
So, we have to visualize it like that
There is a class where all the work has to be done
So, we have made a public class for the class
We will discuss the meaning of public later
For now, public means what everyone can see
So, public class
And what is the name of the class?
We have named the class as Java Basics
In Java, the name of the class and the name of the file should be the same
That is, the name of our public class and the name of the file we have made from .java
should always be the same
In this class, we will define a function
Public, Static, Void, Main
The strange words that we hear
Public, Class, Main, Static, Void
We do not have to worry about them at all
String, Arguments
Now, I have said 6-7 alien level words
But, to explain it very easily
So, this is a function
We can understand a function as a magic button
A magic button that happens when you press it
So, this is a function
A magic button
whose name is Main
Now, the main function is the first thing that a Java compiler finds
whenever it has to execute the Java code
It is such a small thing
We will discuss it in detail later
This much code of Java
Let's save it once
You can write any program of Java
Write it in any code editor
Write it anywhere
You will always have to write this much code
That means you have to define a public class
Along with that, we have to make a main function
These are two things
Public class and main function
Which we always have to make
whenever we have to write a Java code
And this code
I mean, such a code that we always have to write
We call it Boilerplate code
Boilerplate means
Which will be written every time
Which is a template
So, this is a template of a Java code
And all the lines that we are going to write
All the codes that we will personally type
All that will come in this main function
That means we are defining a magic button
In which we are going to do the magic of our code
All these lines
In this much space
Means, in between this curly brace and this curly brace
Whatever lines we will write
That will be our code
So, for now
Already, the heavy code that we write from the beginning
We will not discuss the meaning of it much
Why is it there?
We will not take much tension about it
Boilerplate code will be seen again and again

We will not take much tension about it Boilerplate code will be seen again and again
